page.title: 02CAMBRIDGE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: THE CAMBRIDGE SEWAGE WORKS RECEIVES NEARLY 10\M.GALLONS OF SEWAGE (99% LIQUID).AFTER SEPARATION OF THE DEBRIS,IT IS BROKEN DOWN.THE MUDDY LOOKING SLUDGE GOES INTO ONE TANK WHERE A CHEMICAL IS ADDED.THE WATER IS THEN SQUEEZED OUT LIKE A SPINDRYER.THE SLUDGE IS PILED UP IN A BIG SKIP FOR THE FARMERS COLLECT AS FERTILIZER.MOST OF THE EFFLUENT (80%)COMES FROM CAMBRIDGE CITY.THE WATER PASSES THROUGH THE PUMP HOUSE,BEFORE THE EFFLUENT IS FINALLY LET OUT INTO THE RIVER CAM.THE SEWAGE WORKS HAS BEEN COMPUTERISED FOR OPERATIONAL PURPOSES AND HAS SPARE CAPACITY AT THE MOMENT. THE CHILDREN FOUND THE SMELL UNPLEASANT-WORKERS AT THE PLANT ARE OBVIOUSLY USED TO IT.
